subject: JUnit 3.6
msgSnippet: Dear JUnit developers! Reading so much about classloading problems, I d like to suggest for JU3.6 (or is that already on its way?) 1. Rework of the
messageBody:
Dear JUnit developers!

Reading so much about classloading problems, I'd like to suggest for JU3.6
(or is that already on its way?)

1. Rework of the classloading mechanism. Most people now have to use the
-noloading option,
for one reason or another. E.g. when working with application servers.
Then the startup of a test becomes VERY VERY slow.

2. Eliminating problems related to IDE's. E.g. debugging testcode in
JBuilder4.
(Does not stop on breakpoints.) (Again, a classloading problem??)

I think these things are of much more importance than adding functionality
to JUnit.
I am very, VERY satisfied with what it offers.


... to be continued


- Lucas
